body:
**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:

/kind bug

**What happened**:
1. I create a pod with local volume
2. The scheduler start to do bind, it will make pv pv.spec.claimref.name = pvc.name
3. pv controller will call syncVolume to make pv bound , then syncClaim will make pvc bound.
But from the log, I find that after step 2, pv controller start to reclaim the pv  because pvc not in cache.
logs:

```
I0717 04:49:39.293155       1 pv_controller.go:542] volume "lv-4bfd1301-4ad0-4059-aedf-972b47cfda1d" is released and reclaim policy "Delete" will be executed
I0717 04:49:42.962430       1 pv_controller.go:754] volume "lv-4bfd1301-4ad0-4059-aedf-972b47cfda1d" entered phase "Released"
I0717 04:49:43.111046       1 pv_controller.go:1220] isVolumeReleased[lv-4bfd1301-4ad0-4059-aedf-972b47cfda1d]: volume is released
I0717 04:50:13.858894       1 pv_controller.go:754] volume "lv-4bfd1301-4ad0-4059-aedf-972b47cfda1d" entered phase "Available"

I0717 04:51:41.242761       1 event.go:218] Event(v1.ObjectReference{Kind:"PersistentVolumeClaim", Namespace:"monstor-internal", Name:"largekeyspace2-32574-na-na-slc-59971-document-data-hidden-d27br0-data", UID:"ad721ff5-897c-11e8-bd69-3cfdfe54b0d8", APIVersion:"v1", ResourceVersion:"3639800376", FieldPath:""}): type: 'Normal' reason: 'WaitForFirstConsumer' waiting for first consumer to be created before binding
I0717 04:51:52.088251       1 event.go:218] Event(v1.ObjectReference{Kind:"PersistentVolumeClaim", Namespace:"monstor-internal", Name:"largekeyspace2-32574-na-na-slc-59971-document-data-hidden-d27br0-data", UID:"ad721ff5-897c-11e8-bd69-3cfdfe54b0d8", APIVersion:"v1", ResourceVersion:"3639800376", FieldPath:""}): type: 'Normal' reason: 'WaitForFirstConsumer' waiting for first consumer to be created before binding
I0717 04:54:11.839976       1 event.go:218] Event(v1.ObjectReference{Kind:"PersistentVolumeClaim", Namespace:"monstor-internal", Name:"largekeyspace2-32574-na-na-slc-59971-document-data-hidden-d27br0-data", UID:"ad721ff5-897c-11e8-bd69-3cfdfe54b0d8", APIVersion:"v1", ResourceVersion:"3639800376", FieldPath:""}): type: 'Normal' reason: 'WaitForFirstConsumer' waiting for first consumer to be created before binding
```
We can see after pv reclaimed, then the logs related with pvc start to print out.

I know kube-scheduler will wait for the pvc to be bound, then it will be scheduled again in this situation. But  is there  a better way  to handle this situation  at pv_controller? 
@msau42 


**What you expected to happen**:
PV not reclaimed. 

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
Create pod and  local volume pvc in large scale

**Anything else we need to know?**:

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`):
k8s 1.9
